required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enhanced vs. Routine Clear Liquid Intake in Labor
clinical_study.official_title: Clear Liquids vs Enhanced Clear Liquids; Effect on Labor Performance

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to see if the addition of a carbohydrate- and protein-enhanced gel during labor speeds labor and reduces the rate of cesarean delivery.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients will be randomized to placebo or experimental arm of study. In the placebo arm, patients will receive standard clear liquid diet, which includes ginger ale, variety of fruit juices, and plain soup broth. The experimental arm will receive the standard clear liquid diet, and in addition will receive Accel Gel every 3 hours while in labor.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed during labor until delivery, an expected range of 1-48 hours
primary_outcome.description: Up to 3 days from time of admission

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of second stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed during labor until delivery, an expected range of 1-48 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Time of complete cervical dilation to delivery of infant

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed during labor until delivery, an expected range of 1-48 hours
Participants will be followed during labor until delivery, an expected range of 1-48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: rate of composite adverse GI outcome (vomiting or diarrhea)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 5 days
Participants will be followed during labor until delivery, an expected range of 1-48 hours
Participants will be followed during labor until full dilation, an expected range of 1-48 hours

arm_group.description: This intervention consists of soup broth, variety of juices (apple, cranberry, grape), ginger ale, water, and ice.

This intervention is an enhanced clear liquid gel is Accel Gel, produced by PacificHealth Labs of Matawan, NJ. This gel has 4:1 carb to protein ratio formula, and ingredients that are not contraindicated in pregnancy (only the flavors with minimal caffeine are used). http://www.pacifichealthlabs.com/accel-gel-all-natural-rapid-energy-gel-product.html

intervention.description: Accel Gel by PacificHealth Labs in Matawan, NJ.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Nulliparity (first baby)
- Admission with the intent to deliver vaginally
- Gestational age >36 weeks
- Age â‰¥ 18
Exclusion criteria:
- Planned cesarean delivery
- Renal Disease
- Preeclampsia
- Diabetes (Pre-gestational or Gestational)
- Allergy to any component of sports drink
- NPO diet by physician
